rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;2eac9ec2.1503">   <title>NHS Scotland eHealth Strategy </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;2eac9ec2.1503</link>   <description> Revised strategy now published for anyone who may be interested.<br><br>http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2015/03/5705<br><br>Paul<br><br>Dr Paul Miller<br>Glasgow, UK   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T17:05:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Miller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;2eac9ec2.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;aceca3e1.1503">   <title>Re: PRIMIS on GP data quality at PHCSG conference 2013 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;aceca3e1.1503</link>   <description> If you are gathering patient level data from every patient in England*,does<br>anyone know how the distorting effects of &quot;bad&quot; data will be allowed for in<br>judging care and in resource allocation?<br><br>Or will the CQC answer be that practice ought to be producing good data - in<br>the form envisioned by SCCI - so it will be perfectly reasonable to close<br>them down if they fail to do so? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T08:31:35-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary Hawking</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;aceca3e1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;e1d02cfd.1503">   <title>Re: PRIMIS on GP data quality at PHCSG conference 2013 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;e1d02cfd.1503</link>   <description> But actually a lot of GP data is very good.<br>People using it just need to be aware of the pitfalls.<br><br>Dai<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: GP-UK [mailto:GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Trefor Roscoe<br>Sent: 09 March 2015 03:17<br>To: GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: PRIMIS on GP data quality at PHCSG conference 2013<br><br>And in some cases it is so bad as to be dangerous for many reasons. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T07:44:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Dai Evans (PRIMIS)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;e1d02cfd.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;a5d7eefa.1503">   <title>Re: PRIMIS on GP data quality at PHCSG conference 2013 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;a5d7eefa.1503</link>   <description> And in some cases it is so bad as to be dangerous for many reasons.<br><br>Trefor<br>(In India hence the time stamp)<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: GP-UK [mailto:GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Laurie Slater<br>Sent: 09 March 2015 03:43<br>To: GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: PRIMIS on GP data quality at PHCSG conference 2013<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: GP-UK [mailto:GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Mary Hawking<br>Sent: 02 October 2014 20:12<br>To: GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: PRIMIS on GP data quality at PHCSG conference 2013 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T08:46:41+05:30</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Trefor Roscoe</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;a5d7eefa.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;6d726800.1503">   <title>Re: PRIMIS on GP data quality at PHCSG conference 2013 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;6d726800.1503</link>   <description> -----Original Message-----<br>From: GP-UK [mailto:GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Mary Hawking<br>Sent: 02 October 2014 20:12<br>To: GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: PRIMIS on GP data quality at PHCSG conference 2013<br><br>http://phcsg.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/Data-Quality-%E2%80%93-Data-fit-<br>for-Sharing.pdf<br>I have been looking for something on GP data quality for quite awhile - and<br>had forgotten this.<br>Pity conference talks never have audio of the talk..<br>PRIMIS would seem to confirm my impression that GP data quality is so<br>variable/poor that there is a question as to why anyone would want it! [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-08T22:13:04-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Laurie Slater</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;6d726800.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;15115c0e.1503">   <title>Re: Warner-Lambert action (Demanding branding Gabapentin as Lyrica) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;15115c0e.1503</link>   <description> You may find that a lot of patients with neuropathic pain also have Generalised Anxiety Disorder. The generic pregabalin has a license for that indication.<br><br>Piers Longhorn<br><br>&gt; On 8 Mar 2015, at 10:13, Roger Gardiner &lt;0000022f5a946ffd-dmarc-request@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; How can we be prevented by this ruling from prescribing the others \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdoff-license\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd ?<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Roger<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; On 8 Mar 2015, at 10:08, Adrian Midgley &lt;amidgley@GMAIL.COM&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; Contents: Preamble for cc<br>&gt;&gt; Request for information and action<br>&gt;&gt; Request for dissemination<br>&gt;&gt; Commentary<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; #Preamble:<br>>> 1. Warner Lambert seek to use the Courts [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-08T10:51:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Piers Longhorn</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;15115c0e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5bcf66b9.1503">   <title>Re: Warner-Lambert action (Demanding branding Gabapentin as Lyrica) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5bcf66b9.1503</link>   <description> On Sun, 8 Mar 2015 at 10:13 Roger Gardiner &lt;<br>0000022f5a946ffd-dmarc-request@jiscmail.ac.uk&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; How can we be prevented by this ruling from prescribing the others<br>&gt; \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdoff-license\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd ?<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>IANAL, but the law uses precedents.<br><br>The index item is the anti-bowel-cancer biological which turns out to be<br>the same as an anti-retinal vessel leak and proliferate drug, but much<br>cheaper. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-08T10:22:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Midgley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5bcf66b9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5fdf5dab.1503">   <title>Re: Warner-Lambert action (Demanding branding Gabapentin as Lyrica) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5fdf5dab.1503</link>   <description> How can we be prevented by this ruling from prescribing the others \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdoff-license\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd ?<br><br>Roger<br><br>&gt; On 8 Mar 2015, at 10:08, Adrian Midgley &lt;amidgley@GMAIL.COM&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Contents: Preamble for cc<br>&gt; Request for information and action<br>&gt; Request for dissemination<br>&gt; Commentary<br>&gt;<br>&gt; #Preamble:<br>> 1. Warner Lambert seek to use the Courts to compel NHS prescriptions for Gabapentin a chemical entity now out of patent to be for their branded variety - Lyrica - which is more expensive and from whcih only they may profit on the basis of the condition for which the prescription is. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-08T10:13:00+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Roger Gardiner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5fdf5dab.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;8a28d34d.1503">   <title>Warner-Lambert action (Demanding branding Gabapentin as Lyrica) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;8a28d34d.1503</link>   <description> Contents: Preamble for cc<br>Request for information and action<br>Request for dissemination<br>Commentary<br><br>#Preamble:<br>1. Warner Lambert seek to use the Courts to compel NHS prescriptions for<br>Gabapentin a chemical entity now out of patent to be for their branded<br>variety - Lyrica - which is more expensive and from whcih only they may<br>profit on the basis of the condition for which the prescription is. Lyrica<br>is claimed to be patented for the specific condition of Neuropathic pain. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-08T10:08:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Midgley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;8a28d34d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;c606f522.1503">   <title>End of the GPES IAG </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;c606f522.1503</link>   <description> It has been confirmed and announced that the GPES IAG will cease to exist<br>after 1st July 2015.<br>There are very few details as yet on the changes in IG at the HSCIC, save<br>that data collection and data dissemination will be separated.<br>I've put the links here - https://www.facebook.com/groups/629021217133313/<br><br>Mary Hawking<br>Retired from NHS on 31.3.13 because of the Health and Social Care Act 2012<br>&quot;thinking - independent thinking - is to humans as swimming is to cats: we<br>can do it if we really have to.&quot; Mark Earles on Radio 4<br>blog http://maryhawking.wordpress.com/ And Fred!<br>http://primaryhealthinfo.wordpress.com/2014/12/01/can-integrated-care-satisf<br>y-all-of-freds-needs-including-patient-empowerment/    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T20:06:54-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary Hawking</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;c606f522.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;ffc19fa0.1502">   <title>Re: Variations in GP practice funding in Bristol </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;ffc19fa0.1502</link>   <description> If anyone knows where?<br>I haven't seen it - &amp; needs to have local areas analysed ..<br><br>Mary Hawking<br>Retired from NHS on 31.3.13 because of the Health and Social Care Act 2012<br>&quot;thinking - independent thinking - is to humans as swimming is to cats: we<br>can do it if we really have to.&quot;\ufffd\ufffd Mark Earles on Radio 4<br>blog http://maryhawking.wordpress.com/ And Fred!<br>http://primaryhealthinfo.wordpress.com/2014/12/01/can-integrated-care-satisf<br>y-all-of-freds-needs-including-patient-empowerment/ [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-28T21:14:38-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary Hawking</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;ffc19fa0.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;9648891e.1502">   <title>Re: Variations in GP practice funding in Bristol </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;9648891e.1502</link>   <description> Done nationally on Pulse somewhere<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: GP-UK [mailto:GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Mary Hawking<br>Sent: 28 February 2015 19:59<br>To: GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Variations in GP practice funding in Bristol<br><br>This website is really worth studying - even if you are not in Bristol<br>http://gpinfo.co.uk/index.html Is anyone else doing the same sort of<br>analysis, &amp; if they are, could we make a collection? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-28T20:07:26-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Trefor Roscoe</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;9648891e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;dc60cdbf.1502">   <title>Variations in GP practice funding in Bristol </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;dc60cdbf.1502</link>   <description> This website is really worth studying - even if you are not in Bristol<br>http://gpinfo.co.uk/index.html<br>Is anyone else doing the same sort of analysis, &amp; if they are, could we make<br>a collection?<br><br>Mary Hawking<br>Retired from NHS on 31.3.13 because of the Health and Social Care Act 2012<br>&quot;thinking - independent thinking - is to humans as swimming is to cats: we<br>can do it if we really have to.&quot; Mark Earles on Radio 4<br>blog http://maryhawking.wordpress.com/ And Fred!<br>http://primaryhealthinfo.wordpress.com/2014/12/01/can-integrated-care-satisf<br>y-all-of-freds-needs-including-patient-empowerment/    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-28T19:59:18-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary Hawking</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;dc60cdbf.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;a1485157.1502">   <title>Re: Manchester to take full responsibility for the NHS in Manchester? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;a1485157.1502</link>   <description> Agree with Mary's points.<br><br>Manchester is absolutely the worst funded area in \ufffd\ufffd/pt for general practice.<br><br>IF there was a plan to squeeze General<br>Practitioners until the pips squeaked this is<br>what it would look like. Underfund people till<br>they start to believe any reform must have a chance of making life better.<br><br>Given what has happened to social care and social<br>care funding and given how many local authorities<br>have been found seriously wanting over the years<br>who would choose this as the first option to<br>safeguard the care of our patients? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T00:18:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Julian Bradley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;a1485157.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;7589906a.1502">   <title>Re: Manchester to take full responsibility for the NHS in Manchester? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;7589906a.1502</link>   <description> Here's the NHS Confed response<br><br>http://nhsconfed.org/media-centre/2015/02/nhs-confederation-responds-to-new-partnership-funding-in-greater-manchester<br><br>On 25 Feb 2015, at 19:50, Mary Hawking &lt;maryhawking@TIGERS.DEMON.CO.UK&gt; wrote:<br><br>Thanks, Dinesh: I hadn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd hardly surprising seeing it was issued at 13.29!<br>From this News-<br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdthe move \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd which could see Greater Manchester make more of its own decisions around the health and social care needs of its residents \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd follows the historic devolution settlement with Government on November 3, 2014. Greater power for the cities in the north is central to the government\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds vision of a Northern Powerhouse. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T21:36:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Dinesh Patel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;7589906a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5fe80368.1502">   <title>Re: Manchester to take full responsibility for the NHS in Manchester? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5fe80368.1502</link>   <description> Is this another step in the breakup of the NHS - or not so National health service?<br>I can see the logic of aligning health and social care on some levels - so long as the benefits outweigh the problems.<br>This may prove to be problematical - there is the central government statement that NHS budgets are not being cut; [ignoring any reckonings about health service inflation etc], but local government budgets are being cut and this is impacting already and directly on those elements of the health service that are now under local authority control i.e. Public Health. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T20:42:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Dai Evans (PRIMIS)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;5fe80368.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;1a043451.1502">   <title>Re: Manchester to take full responsibility for the NHS in Manchester? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;1a043451.1502</link>   <description> Thanks, Dinesh: I hadn\ufffd\ufffdt \ufffd\ufffd hardly surprising seeing it was issued at 13.29!<br><br>From this News-<br><br>\ufffd\ufffdthe move \ufffd\ufffd which could see Greater Manchester make more of its own<br>decisions around the health and social care needs of its residents \ufffd\ufffd follows<br>the historic devolution settlement with Government on November 3, 2014.<br>Greater power for the cities in the north is central to the government\ufffd\ufffds<br>vision of a Northern Powerhouse. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T19:50:34-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary Hawking</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;1a043451.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;1ce6bed.1502">   <title>Re: Manchester to take full responsibility for the NHS in Manchester? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;1ce6bed.1502</link>   <description> Presume you will have seen this today<br><br>http://www.england.nhs.uk/2015/02/25/manchester-new-partnership/?app_data=%7B%22pi%22%3A%2255153_1424871764_301487129%22%2C%22pt%22%3A%22twitter%22%7D<br><br>On 25 Feb 2015, at 09:42, Mary Hawking &lt;maryhawking@TIGERS.DEMON.CO.UK&gt; wrote:<br><br>I heard on Today Radio4 that the whole of the NHS in Greater Manchester is<br>to be devolved to the Greater Manchester Council with effect from April<br>2016, and that this will be announced in Parliament later this week.<br>Has anyone heard anything about this? As a result of that and<br>other changed, all 87 practices in Sheffield are setting up one company to<br>represent them in contract negotiations. I will be on the board and am<br>involved in drawing up the terms and conditions etc.<br><br>Trefor<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: GP-UK [mailto:GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Dreaves, Hilary<br>Sent: 25 February 2015 09:51<br>To: GP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Manchester to take full responsibility for the NHS in<br>Manchester? Today didn't seem to have any details.<br>Can NHS England or Jeremy Hunt just decide to do this without primary<br>legislation, where is the Risk Analysis, and, seeing that the Greater<br>Manchester CCGs seem to have the lowest funding per weighted patient in the<br>country, http://www.hscic.gov.uk/6037 how will the budget be decided, now<br>and in [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T09:42:49-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary Hawking</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;d9817953.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;7393ee91.1502">   <title>Re: CARE-IS decision support </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;7393ee91.1502</link>   <description> Closed source using a proprietary database?<br>I suppose some people would like that.<br><br>On Tue Feb 24 2015 at 22:26:47 Paul Miller &lt;paulagmiller@gmail.com&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; Does anyone have experience of this decision support service / product?<br>&gt;<br>&gt; http://www.care-is.co.uk/<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I understand that it is being implemented in NHS England &quot;with INPS<br>&gt; Vision&quot; and also in use in 98% of practices in New Zealand.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; The web site is a bit short on specifics, though I see it makes use of<br>&gt; Escro / Albasoft data used for enhanced services in some HBs in NHS<br>> Scotland. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T04:14:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Midgley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;7393ee91.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;be2139d6.1502">   <title>CARE-IS decision support </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;be2139d6.1502</link>   <description> Does anyone have experience of this decision support service / product?<br><br>http://www.care-is.co.uk/<br><br>I understand that it is being implemented in NHS England &quot;with INPS Vision&quot;<br>and also in use in 98% of practices in New Zealand.<br><br>The web site is a bit short on specifics, though I see it makes use of<br>Escro / Albasoft data used for enhanced services in some HBs in NHS<br>Scotland. (Not mine though which uses MSD's products). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T22:26:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Miller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;be2139d6.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;46a5514a.1502">   <title>Anyone got any favourite software or tweeks? Could be a useful resource for all! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;46a5514a.1502</link>   <description> http://www.ehi.co.uk/insight/CCIO/1417/enter-the-ccg-on-wall-washing-and-sex<br><br>John Lockley has been musing on the EHI CCIO section - and there's a lot of<br>sense here.<br>Would it be useful to start a list on GP-UK or Facebook?<br><br>Mary Hawking<br>Retired from NHS on 31.3.13 because of the Health and Social Care Act 2012<br>&quot;thinking - independent thinking - is to humans as swimming is to cats: we<br>can do it if we really have to.&quot; Mark Earles on Radio 4<br>blog http://maryhawking.wordpress.com/ And Fred!<br>http://primaryhealthinfo.wordpress.com/2014/12/01/can-integrated-care-satisf<br>y-all-of-freds-needs-including-patient-empowerment/    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T16:37:58-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary Hawking</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;46a5514a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;b8a7a67.1502">   <title>Re: NDA and smoking data </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;b8a7a67.1502</link>   <description> Indeed. This is not suspicion.<br><br>On Thu Feb 05 2015 at 21:07:45 Tim Walter &lt;tim@yingtong.co.uk&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; We are being pressured to collect annual smoking data for all diabetics<br>&gt; for the NDA (even long term non smokers.)<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm objecting to pointless data collection just to fulfil an audit,<br>&gt; national or otherwise.<br>&gt;<br>> I accept collecting smoking data if its worthwhile, but object if its [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T21:14:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Midgley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;80240d35.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;92b8894f.1502">   <title>NDA and smoking data </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;92b8894f.1502</link>   <description> We are being pressured to collect annual smoking data for all diabetics for the NDA (even long term non smokers.)<br><br>I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm objecting to pointless data collection just to fulfil an audit, national or otherwise.<br><br>I accept collecting smoking data if its worthwhile, but object if its just to tick boxes.<br><br>I know we can just refuse (or capitulate) but instead of that has anyone got a solution or advice to solve this \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdrequirement\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (or has someone locally misinterpretted the rules for NDA?) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T21:07:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tim Walter</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;92b8894f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;3d495b46.1502">   <title>Re: Care Data Programme Board has published some meeting information.. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;3d495b46.1502</link>   <description> Ombudsman/ICO perhaps?<br>The organisation does not give the appearance of honesty, alas. It may be<br>one reason why people are so unconvinced by them.<br><br>On Tue Feb 03 2015 at 14:36:00 Mary Hawking &lt;maryhawking@tigers.demon.co.uk&gt;<br>wrote:<br><br>&gt; The Care Data Programme Board published some meeting information and TOR<br>&gt; yesterday<br>&gt; http://www.england.nhs.uk/ourwork/tsd/care-data/prog-board/<br>&gt; The TOR make it clear that non-publication was intended from the outset,<br>&gt; and<br>&gt; the meeting papers are heavily redacted. In the proposal to publish this is<br>&gt; shown in the flow-chart as &quot;any information commercial-in-confidence<br>> redacted": not sure how this applies to the RAG status [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T15:05:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Midgley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;3d495b46.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;c17657eb.1502">   <title>Care Data Programme Board has published some meeting information.. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GP-UK;c17657eb.1502</link>   <description> The Care Data Programme Board published some meeting information and TOR<br>yesterday<br>http://www.england.nhs.uk/ourwork/tsd/care-data/prog-board/<br>The TOR make it clear that non-publication was intended from the outset, and<br>the meeting papers are heavily redacted. In the proposal to publish this is<br>shown in the flow-chart as &quot;any information commercial-in-confidence<br>redacted&quot;: not sure how this applies to the RAG status in the Highlight<br>report from the December meeting!<br>The Decision to Publish Table for each meeting is interesting: most of the<br>papers are labelled Exempt - which appears to be either commercial of policy<br>forming.
